title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text:
A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.
$$y \leq  rac{-2}{3} x+5$$
$$0 \leq 0 rac{-2}{3}+5$$
$$0 \leq 5$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is a solution to $$y \leq \frac{-2}{3} x+5$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the left side of the line, we shade the left side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$x \geq 3$$ on the same grid. Recognize that it is a vertical line through $$x=3$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \geq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose $$(0,0)$$ as a test point to see if it is a solution.\n$$x \geq 3$$\n$$0 \geq 3$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: $$(0,0)$$ is not a solution to $$x \geq 3$$. Since $$(0,0)$$ is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the right side of the line $$x=3$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
